Name: Knife
Description: This silex knife was found in a burial at El-Girza and consists of a sturdy, elongated blade characterised by a distinctive grain. The grain is close to the heavily worked right-hand edge and forms the spine of the knife. One end is rounded and the other is pointed. The rounded end, to which the handle must have been attached, is at the distal end of the blade. The pointed end has been carefully worked. The cutting edge of the knife has been retouched with numerous, tiny flakes.
